thread.title: Shannon twins injured in wreck, Kristina gets DUI: report
thread.title_full: Shannon twins injured in wreck, Kristina gets DUI: report - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Shannon twins injured in wreck, Kristina gets DUI: report
text:
SunOfHollywood.com Playboy Playmate Karissa Shannon (pictured) was hospitalized with her twin sister, Kristina, after crashing their SUV. Playboy founder Hugh Hefner's former twin girlfriends were hospitalized, and one was charged with DUI, after they wrecked their SUV en route to get their nipples pierced.
Kristina Shannon and her twin sister, Karissa Shannon, were taken to a hospital Monday with scratches and bruises after the rollover accident, TMZ reported Friday. Police charged driver Kristina, still in a hospital gown, with misdemeanor DUI.
Rescuers reportedly hoisted Karissa out of the Mercedes-Benz G-Class through the windshield, and firefighters sliced open the roof to pull out Kristina.
The twins have had a hard time coping with the recent death of their mother, a source told the Daily News.
SunOfHollywood.com Playboy Playmate Karissa Shannon after her car accident. Enlarge SunOfHollywood.com Playboy Playmate Karissa Shannon after her car accident. Enlarge Playboy Playmate Karissa Shannon (pictured) and her sister, Kristina, were hospitalized after they crashed their SUV.
The 26-year-old Playmates became Hef's girlfriends in 2008 and starred in the E! reality series "The Girls Next Door," making viewers see double with their penchant for dressing identically .
Rodrigo Vaz/FilmMagic The Shannon twins arrive at a party on Nov. 7, 2013 in Hollywood, Calif. The Michigan-born twins also admitted on an Oct. 6 episode of the plastic-surgery reality show "Botched" to drinking while on post-op painkillers, against doctorsâ€™ orders.
The DUI charge isn't the twins' first run-in with the law. Karissa and Kristina were charged in St. Petersburg in January 2008 with felony aggravated assault after a house party brawl, and Karissa was arrested on a misdemeanor battery charge months before that.
Photos courtesy of SunOfHollywood.com
mjagannathan@nydailynews.com
